meanings.definition: The quality or state of being noble
meanings.sent1: Her kindness and generosity truly exemplify nobility.
meanings.sent2: The king was known for his nobility and honor.
meanings.sent3: The cat's regal behavior almost seemed to mimic nobility.
meanings.sent4: In the world of chess, the queen symbolizes nobility on the board.
meanings.sent5: The knight's shining armor represented the essence of nobility.

meanings.definition: A class of people of high social or political status
meanings.sent1: The royal family belonged to the nobility of the country.
meanings.sent2: In the past, only the nobility had access to certain privileges.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to be part of the nobility while playing dress-up.
meanings.sent4: The nobility of the town gathered for the annual ball.
meanings.sent5: The nobility's elegant attire stood out in the crowd.

meanings.definition: A group of people belonging to the aristocracy
meanings.sent1: The nobility of the kingdom held significant power and influence.
meanings.sent2: Throughout history, the nobility played a crucial role in shaping society.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel acted as if it were part of the nobility of the forest.
meanings.sent4: The nobility's grand estate was the envy of all in the region.
meanings.sent5: The nobility's lineage traced back to ancient times.
